issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

resolution.description: A fix for this issue is checked into the tree and tested.
resolution.name: Fixed

fields.summary: RBF: Illegal Router Admin command leads to printing usage for all commands

status.description: A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.
status.name: Resolved

issuetype.description: An improvement or enhancement to an existing feature or task.
issuetype.name: Improvement

status.description: A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.
status.name: Resolved

fields.description:
*Scenario:*

Current behaviour for the dfsrouteradmin command is: First argument should be valid one. What ever value we give as the second argument, the command is successfull.

 

*Examples:*

hdfs dfsrouteradmin -safemode enter leave

hdfs dfsrouteradmin -safemode leave enter

hdfs dfsrouteradmin -safemode get jashfuesfhsk

hdfs dfsrouteradmin -safemode leave leave

 

With the above examples, command is successfull for the first argument.

 

*Expected:*

Add check to have single valid argument to the safemode command
fields.summary: RBF: Add check to have single valid argument to safemode command

Thanx [~SoumyaPN] for raising the issue.
Have uploaded the patch.
Pls Review!!!

Maybe we should be a little more specific in the error messages.
In one case we should say that we have too many parameters and that the maximum is X.
In the other case, we should say that X is not a valid option and that the valid ones are Y,Z.

Thanx [~elgoiri] for the suggestions.

yes indeed the exceptions were quite general.

Have made the changes as suggested by you.Just one thing not added what are the valid parameters in case of invalid parameters since after error message,printUsage() method is called which will print the correct usage.

Hence we will be repeating the stuff again.

Uploaded the patch v3 with the suggestions.

Pls Review!!!!

Patch V3 looks fine to me. +1

Test failures doesn't seem related.
{quote} In the other case, we should say that X is not a valid option and that the valid ones are Y,Z
{quote}
I think, as [~ayushtkn] said. {{printUsage()}} already prints the whole usage, need not include usage in the error message, just mention of "Invalid argument" should be fine.
 May be {{printUsage()}} can be optimized to print only usage of specific command on error. Anyway this can be done in separate jira, if no problem with compatibility.

Thanks [~vinayrpet] for the review.

As suggested raised a seperate Jira HDFS-13861 to optimize the printUsage().

Thanks [~linyiqun] for the review.
Made changes as per your comments.
Pls Review!!!
